FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet.org will begin requiring two-factor authentication for accounts starting March 8th.
The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription:
Opened issue "[A11y] List element on search page cannot have a direct child
element" (#9402) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Accessibility issue on the search page

A list element cannot have a child line break element. We wanted to place the package tags on a new line, so we'll have to find another way to do this.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/82980589/221028298-917d519f-baf6-480f-b899-5012c955624f.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.02.23]RI of dev into main" (#9401) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Closed pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.02.23]FI of main into dev" (#9400) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[ReleasePrep][2023.02.23]FI of main into dev" (#9400) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "The alternative package cannot be found through clicking the link in deprecated package info" (#9399) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "URL redirect and ValidateIssuer CodeQL bugs" (#9398) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses 4 NuGetGallery CodeQL issues. All of them required suppressions of the warnings rather than any fixes.

1. **AuthenticationController.cs (2)**
    - _Problem:_ Untrusted URL redirection due to user-provided value. ([Bug #1632796](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1632796), [Bug #1632797](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1632797))
    -  _Solution:_ The redirect URLs used here are relative site URLs generated by us, and do not use any user-provided values.
3. **ValidateRecaptchaResponseAttribute.cs (1)**
    - _Problem:_ Potential server side request forgery due to a user-provided value flowing to a constructor or method from class 
                         System.Net.Http.HttpClient. ([Bug #1632800](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1632800))
    -  _Solution:_ The Recaptcha validation URL flagged here does not use any user-provided values either.
5. **AzureActiveDirectoryV2Authenticator.cs (1)**
    - _Problem:_ "The security sensitive property ValidateIssuer is being disabled by the followign value: false." We were disabling 
                         the ValidateIssuer flag in our AAD auth. When Issuer Validation is turned on, the issuer in the token is compared 
                         against a list of accepted tenants. ([Bug #1632802](https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1632802))
    -  _Solution:_  We have a multi-tenant app, and do not restrict token issuers to a limited set of tenants, so we can keep this 
                         flag off.

Part of https://github.com/NuGet/Engineering/issues/4593

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: Account linked to another email" (#9397) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

Hello there, 

In the past I've created an organization in nuget called codescovery. 
Apparently it's linked to the email **REDACTED - PII**
I would like to link the account to **REDACTED - PII**




### Repro Steps

Trying to login into nuget.org using **REDACTED - PII**

### Expected Behavior

Manage Nuget Account using **REDACTED - PII**

### Screenshots

**REDACTED - PII**

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "WebSite projects opened from IIS fail to install packages" (#12337) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI, Visual Studio Package Manager Console

### Product Version

VS 17.4

### Worked before?

17.3

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

1. In IIS Manager, create a virtual directory as an application.
2. In VS, use "open website", select "local IIS", and then select the directory
3. Try to install a package that has `lib/<tfm>/*.dll` files.

An obscure error message is reported: 

> Failed to add reference to ‘Newtonsoft.Json’.
> 
> Invalid URI: The Authority/Host could not be parsed.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "GlobalPackageReference is not working for legacy-style csproj projects" (#12368) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

VS 17.4.4

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Create a solution with both a SDK-style csproj file and a legacy-style csproj file (e.g. .NET Framework project).
2. Add a NuGet package to both.
3. Enable Central Package Management per [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/Central-Package-Management#).
4. Note that Central Package Management works fine for both project types.
5. Add a Global Package Reference (per [documentation](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/nuget/consume-packages/Central-Package-Management#global-package-references)) to the `Directory.Packages.props` file, e.g. [PolySharp](https://www.nuget.org/packages/PolySharp/).
6. Note that the global package reference works in the SDK-style project but is **not** working in the legacy-style project.

`<PackageReference>` and the base feature of Central Package Management both work with legacy-style csproj files, so why doesn't `<GlobalPackageReference>` work too?

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet should include the files emitted during restore in the binary log" (#12374) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

During a build, it is possible to embed arbitrary files in the binary log.  The .NET SDK by default includes the `project.assets.json` file during build: https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/pull/16840

However, during restore the file does not exist yet so a binlog for just restore can be missing files.  NuGet should include these files after restore is complete.

### Additional Context and Details

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Technical spec for package shading" (#11005) at NuGet/Home
Opened issue "The icons of installed vulnerable package version show incorrectly in the “Installed” tab" (#12453) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.6.0.27

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:
1. Create a C# Console App (.NET Framework 4.8.1) project in VS.
2. Right-Click the project in the Solution Explorer window and select ‘Manage NuGet Packages…’.
3. Click “Browse” tab, search a package (e.g. “Newtonsoft.Json”), select a vulnerable package version (e.g. 12.01) in the “Version” drop-down list and click the “Install” button on the right.
4. Click “OK” button in the “Preview Changes” dialog and click “I Accept” button in the “License Acceptance” dialog.
5. Click “Installed” tab and observe the package list.

#### Expected:
The icons of installed vulnerable package version show correctly in the “Installed” tab.

#### Actual:
The icons of installed vulnerable package version show incorrectly in the “Installed” tab as below screenshot.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20632625/220890355-ad4404d5-53e5-4b53-970a-70af91c023e7.png)

#### Notes:
1.	It doesn’t repro on non-vulnerable package version for the same installed package.
2.	It doesn’t happen in “Browse” tab/”Updates” tab.
3.	It doesn't repro on VS Main\33419.19 + NuGet Client Dev\6.6.0.24.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Allow configuring sources as authentication required or preferred" (#12451) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet.exe, Visual Studio Package Management UI, MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

Today, the NuGet tooling relies on a 401 challenge to understand whether a source needs auth. 
This adds a roundtrip for a few of the urls hit the client. 

It would be nice, if NuGet would just try to acquire credentials for certain feeds as marked by the user. 

This would mean no wasted requests and allow for the source to cleanly know the difference between an authenticated and unauthenticated user from the onset and maybe build some experiences of off that.

### Additional Context and Details

The behavior today, only as needed works great when a feed is either fully public, no 401 challenges, or fully private, 401 challenge on every url, but it's not really smooth for sources that may for example be only partially public. 

When I'm calling the source public/private, I'm only referring to the restore side. Push tends to require authn even on feeds that are public for restore.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "The alternative package cannot be found through clicking the link in deprecated package info" (#12452) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

Visual Studio Package Management UI

### Product Version

NuGet Client Dev\6.6.0.27

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It's more difficult to complete my work

### Repro Steps & Context

#### Repro Steps:    

1. Create a C# Console App (.Net Core 7.0) project.  

2. Right-click the project in Solution Explorer and select "Manage NuGet Packages…" menu item to open PM UI.  

3. Click the settings button, add a deprecated package source https://apidev.nugettest.org/v3-index/index.json and click “OK” button. 

4. Select the deprecated package source and go to "Browse" tab. 

5. Search for a deprecated package "Test10K" in "Browse" tab. 

6. Click the link “affine” under the description of the package “Test10K” or the link “afine” on the right panel. 

#### Expected:    

The alternative package “afine” is showing in the searched package list. 

#### Actual:    

The alternative package “afine” cannot be found through clicking the link in deprecated package info as below screenshot: 
![MicrosoftTeams-image (8)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84695155/220860029-a2547789-0b52-4854-82ee-258524c61eb6.png)

#### Notes: 

1.The alternative package can be shown by searching the package name “affine” in “Browse" tab as below screenshot: 
![MicrosoftTeams-image (9)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/84695155/220860241-d6dd8ebc-ab0d-4db6-bee9-3c80e55663fb.png)
2. It's doesn't repro on VS Main\33419.19 + NuGet Client Dev\6.6.0.24.


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "eng/pipelines/templates/pipeline.yml references unused `SDKVersionForBuild` variable" (#12449) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/3924 removed use of the `SDKVersionForBuild` pipeline variable; however, [eng/pipelines/templates/pipeline.yml still references it](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/blob/c75145efc257c579ccef1e8e038bc9e47e688f49/eng/pipelines/templates/pipeline.yml#L106).

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.org migration towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure" (#60) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
In the coming weeks, nuget.org will be migrating towards a new multi-CDN infrastructure that will improve the experience of our users. This change allows our team flexibility to switch to a back-up provider in the case that one CDN is down, which will broaden coverage for our users.

Some changes are coming for older TLS cipher suites, which may result in connectivity issues. From our data we believe this will affect only a small percentage of requests. We will be monitoring all feedback channels during the migration to assess impact and adjust our roll-out timeline as needed.

Below, we provide resources to determine whether you will be affected by this change. This utilizes the [.NET CLI](https://dotnet.microsoft.com/) to install a package from our pre-production (INT) environment which tests connectivity:


```
mkdir cdn-test
cd cdn-test
dotnet new classlib
dotnet add package BaseTestPackage.NetStandard --source https://apiint.nugettest.org/v3/index.json
```

If you are experiencing connectivity issues while connecting to nuget.org or restoring packages from https://api.nuget.org/v3/index.json, such as:

"The SSL connection could not be established"

Please ensure that TLS 1.2 and any of the following cipher suites have been enabled on your machine:

TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_ECDHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_256_GCM_SHA384
TLS_DHE_RSA_WITH_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

If you have any questions, do reach out to us at support@nuget.org or by commenting on the discussion issue: NuGet/Home#11058
This repo doesn't accept issues. Please see README.md in the root for more details.
This repo doesn't accept issues. Please see README.md in the root for more details.
